p: Plots invaded by S. gigantea had a lower soil moisture content than uninvaded plots (F 1,50 = 6.58, p = 0.0134; Table 2, Figure 1). This overall effect could mainly be attributed to the slightly lower moisture content of invaded plots in the riparian vegetation habitats (F 1,50 = 5.79, p = 0.0199; Table 3, Figure 1).
